Having one of the most extensive jade collections in the USA, this museum really does a great job showcasing asian art and talent. Some of the most interesting pieces are in the polynesian south pacific exhibits with the crazy looking masks.
Sorry I missed this place for so long!

The Rama exhibit was quite informative and a tour de force. The depth and diversity as well as clarity of message put forward by the exhibit made it possible to better understand some of the resident exhibits. In some cases I think exhibits that are part of the SF Asian Art Museum could be better described in light of experiencing the visiting exhibit.
Saw much, but feel I need to go back and fill in the missing parts of the experience!
Wonder what's on the 4th floor?!

Wonderful collection - well organized. two floors of permanent collection plus temporary exhibits.

we opted not to see the current Rama/Epic show as we wanted to focus on the permanent collection - despite arriving at 10:35, we joined the docent's 10:30 tour and thoroughly enjoyed her showing us highlights of the collection... We had the audio guides (free) as well and when we finished the tour, we went back up to the third level and started again.

There are great works and great exhibitry and explanatory panels - I learned much about some buddhist concepts which I have been familiar with but was happy for clarification!

good gift shoppe too!

Run to see the Rama, the Epic, the current special exhibit on the ground floor before it closes on Jan. 15. This spectacular show brings together pieces from the British Museum, East Coast museums, the San Diego Museum of Art (the Binney collection) as well as the Asian Art Museum. There's a good mix of types, periods (traditional and modern), and places (India and Southeast Asia). Don't wait as this stunning show will not tour to other venues. The museum shop also and always has fresh and interesting pieces that complement their collection -- books, textiles, jewelry, and prints.

Great Museum - NOT just for Asian art

This is a great museum, and I go back just to revisit the basket exhibit as often as possible. They have some of the most unique, and rare collections. Take in all the floors, and make sure you don't rush - wall art is even some of the finest in SF.

WOW (in every sense of the word)

We came intending to see the entire museum in one go, but ended up just barely finishing the third floor (India and a bit of Iran, Nepal/Tibet and China). A FEAST for the eyes, and one that left us both over-stuffed and ezhausted. Lots of beautiful items, but there are so many! My work takes me to Saudi Arabia a lot, and it was a great pleasure to see a culture (India's) that embraces female sexual it and it's power.

The Rama Epic at the San Francisco Asian Art Museum is a must see. Plan your time to take both the docent tour and the audio headphone tour. ( Spoiler alert, but good to know, the galleries present from the view of the epics major characters.) The art work on display is outstanding. A highlight are the video presentations from popular culture performances of the Rama Epic. You will leave with a warm understanding of the epic but still processing everything you have seen and heard. I have visited twice to appreciate the complexity of the story and the breath of the collection presented for the exhibit. Ends January 15, 2017

Wanted to see the ROC exhibit.

It was very crowded and the visitors were not friendly or polite. Maybe they were trying to protect the objects from light damage, but the room were so dark that we could not appreciate many of the small objects or read the signs near the art. Some of the signs were not near the objects. The many items on display were too crowded together and only a few could get near the cases. Wanted a flashlight at times. Maybe binoculars would have helped. Maybe we were there at a very, very busy time.

What a great museum, went here for the Epic Rama exhibit, great exhibits in four different exhibit halls. Well curated with easy to follow notes. Highly recommend this place. Exhibits change, a must for your next visit to the city. There is a nice cafe on main floor!

This gem of a museum has a wide variety of S. Asian and Asian Art that is unparalled in many of the other museums I have seen on my travels. One room is better than the next.

The museum has a really interesting variety of Asian art. It's laid out really well and each piece is more intriguing than the next! I especially liked the contemporary Asian art.

We went at 4 pm and the entry fee was discounted. We spent about an hour or so in the Museum. You can definitely spend longer if you listen to each segment of the audio tour. The audio tour is included in the admission price and you can choose which portions to listen to. It was definitely value added!

I heard that the Asian Art Museum in SF was wonderful and a recent trip there confirmed it! What a great collection ofr art from all over Asia (China, Japan, Korea, India, the Himalayan regions, Pakistan, Indonesia, Persia, etc.). I downloaded a free app to my phone which provided excellent narration when I wanted it and highlighted the masterpieces. I highly recommend a visit. I also greatly enjoyed the restaurant and the gift shop.

I enjoyed the museum mostly because I went on free admission day. I don't think the constant collections warrant the price of a ticket. History is shown most through artifacts like pots/pans, many many pots and pans. The layout of the museum is odd so do not be fooled by the giant staircase that takes you to the upstairs exhibits, there are more exhibits reached by entry near the cafeteria.
